cards.name: Morgue Manager
cards.originalText:
Flash
If a player would search their library, that player instead puts the top three cards of their library into their graveyard, then searches their graveyard.

rulings.text: Morgue Manager doesn't change what cards you search for. For example, if you would search your library for up to two basic land cards that share a land type, you instead search your graveyard for up to two basic land cards that share a land type.
Since the graveyard is a public zone, you can't fail to find if there are cards that match the search criteria.
You still shuffle your library after searching, even though you don't get to look at it.
If a card is put from a graveyard into a graveyard due to an effect like Entomb, that card is moved to the top of that graveyard.
Unlike Restless Librarian or Aven Mindcensor, this effect only applies if a player would search their own library.
If a player is affected by both Restless Librarian and Morgue Manager, the player chooses which of the two effects to apply.
Searching the top four cards of a library still counts as searching that library, so a player affected by both Aven Mindcensor and Morgue Manager ends up using Morgue Manager's effect.

cards.name: Torch Singer
cards.originalText:
Accomplice (Whenever another creature you control attacks, you may tap this creature.)
Whenever Torch Singer becomes an accomplice, gain control of target creature until end of turn. Tap it. It's attacking.

rulings.text: Although the creature you gain control of is an attacking creature, it was never declared as an attacking creature. This means that abilities that trigger whenever a creature attacks won't trigger when it changes control and becomes attacking.

The creature you gain control of ignores any effects that say that the creature can't attack or can't attack a certain player (such as the defender ability or the card Propaganda), since they affect only the declaration of attackers.

cards.name: Vigilante Firebug
cards.originalText:
First strike
Players can't gain life.
Whenever a player casts a spell from a graveyard or exile, Vigilante Firebug deals 2 damage to that player.

rulings.text: Spells and abilities that would normally cause a player to gain life still resolve, but the life-gain part simply has no effect.
If a cost includes life gain (like Invigorate's alternative cost does), that cost can't be paid.
Effects that would replace gaining life with some other effect won't be able to do anything because it's impossible for players to gain life.
Effects that replace an event with gaining life (like Words of Worship's effect does) will end up replacing the event with nothing.

If an effect says to set your life total to a certain number, and that number is higher than your current life total, that effect will normally cause you to gain life equal to the difference. With Vigilante Firebug on the battlefield, that part of the effect won't do anything. (If the number is lower than your current life total, the effect will work as normal.)

cards.text:

cards.originalText: Uncanny Woodghast has all activated abilities of all lands you control.

rulings.text: Uncanny Woodghast doesn't just have your lands' mana abilities.

Uncanny Woodghast gains only activated abilities. It doesn't gain triggered abilities or static abilities. Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written “[Cost]: [Effect].” Some keywords are activated abilities; they generally have colons in their reminder text.
Each Plains has the activated ability “{T}: Add {W}.” The other four basic land types are similar. Uncanny Woodghast has these abilities as well.

If an activated ability references the card it's printed on by name, treat the transferred version of that ability as though it referenced Uncanny Woodghast by name instead. For example, if you control a Sprawling Coils, Uncanny Woodghast has the abilities "{T}: Add {C}" and "{T}, Sacrifice Uncanny Woodghast: Search your library for a Mountain or Forest card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library."
Activating Uncanny Woodghast's transferred version of Holo-Den's second ability doesn't do anything unless Uncanny Woodghast is somehow a land.
Unlike with cards like Quicksilver Elemental, the costs of the activated abilities Uncanny Woodghast gains must be paid with the correct colors of mana.

cards.name: Impenetrable Vault
cards.originalText:
Creatures entering the battlefield don't cause abilities to trigger.
{2}, Sacrifice Impenetrable Vault: Draw a card.

rulings.text: Triggered abilities use the word “when,” “whenever,” or “at.” They're often written as “[Trigger condition], [effect].”
Abilities that create replacement effects, such as a permanent entering the battlefield tapped or with counters on it, are unaffected.
Abilities that apply “as [this creature] enters the battlefield,” such as choosing a creature to copy with Uncanny Duplicant, are also unaffected.
Impenetrable Vault's ability stops a creature's own enters-the-battlefield triggered abilities as well as other triggered abilities that would trigger when a creature enters the battlefield.

The trigger event doesn't have to specify “creatures” entering the battlefield. For example, Amulet of Vigor says “Whenever a permanent enters the battlefield tapped and under your control, untap it.” If a creature enters the battlefield tapped and under your control, Amulet of Vigor's ability would not trigger. If a land (that isn't also a creature) enters the battlefield tapped and under your control, Amulet of Vigor's ability would trigger.

Look at the permanent as it exists on the battlefield, taking into account continuous effects, to determine whether any triggered abilities will trigger. For example, if you control March of the Machines, which says, in part, “Each noncreature artifact is an artifact creature,” each artifact will be a creature at the time it enters the battlefield and will not cause triggered abilities to trigger.
If Impenetrable Vault and a creature enter the battlefield at the same time, the creature entering the battlefield won't cause triggered abilities to trigger.
